Chef Alain Ducasse gives you his recipe for the perfect crêpes to go with our hazelnut and peanut spreads. | For about 10 crêpes, You will need: | 100g flour | 10g caster sugar | 1 pinch of salt | 1 egg | 25cl milk | 25g melted butter | 5g oil | 1 orange zest | lemon zest | clarified butter. | Sift the flour and add the sugar. Beat the eggs with the salt. Gently pour them over the flour, stir until the mixture is smooth. Pour in the milk little by little, stirring constantly. Then add the melted butter and oil. Finally grate in the orange and lemon peel. Leave the batter to rest for 2 hours in the fridge. | Cook the crêpes in a non-stick pan greased with clarified butter. | 3,2,1 Spread! | *Clarified butter is more resitant to high temperatures. To obtain it, melt soft butter, remove the white foam at the surface, then filter.
